page.title: 04Petworth Medical Centre
page.content: The Fairfield Medical Centre is on the south-east side of the town off Grove Lane. It was built in 1978-79 and Mr. Horton was the founder. The five doctors see people with diseases, rashes etc. and prescribe medicine. They also have a social section that deals with district nurses and social workers. It is the place in the town where people can come for help. In the surgery they have got a waiting room, treatment room, five doctors,offices, a prescription room,a conference room,a video room and a social section. At the surgery there are 7 office staff, 1 cleaner, 1 gardener, 2 duty nurses and approx. 12 social workers.There is always a trainee doctor. The doctors work an 80 hour week.They have one computer which orders medicine.
